B. Business application owner

The authority to accept the associated risk of not having redundancy for a critical application typically rests with the business application owner. The application owner is responsible for understanding the criticality of the application to the business and making decisions regarding risk acceptance or mitigation based on that understanding.

While other roles like the Business Continuity Director (Option A), Disaster Recovery Manager (Option C), and Data Center Manager (Option D) may have important roles to play in ensuring the availability of IT services, it is ultimately the business owner or application owner who should make decisions regarding the risk posture of their specific application in alignment with business needs and priorities.

questions.question_text: The GREATEST concern when maintaining a risk register is that:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. significant changes in risk factors are excluded.

The greatest concern when maintaining a risk register is the omission of significant changes in risk factors. A risk register is a dynamic tool used to capture and track various risks faced by an organization. Failure to include significant changes in risk factors can result in outdated risk assessments and may lead to inadequate risk response planning. Keeping the risk register up to date with relevant and current risk information is crucial for effective risk management.

Selected Answer: B
Agree it is B.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would BEST help an enterprise prioritize risk scenarios?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Placement on the risk map

The risk map is a visual representation of risks that takes into account their likelihood and impact. By placing risk scenarios on a risk map, you can effectively prioritize them based on their relative positions. Risks that are positioned in the high-likelihood, high-impact quadrant are typically of the highest priority and should be addressed first. This approach allows for a clear and visual understanding of which risks require immediate attention and which can be addressed later.

Selected Answer: D
Agree it is D.
